FXG, can I ask you something about DAR (Display Aspect Ratio): why is it on some DVDRips so BIG? I mean, when played on full-screen mode, the picture has very large BLACK space above and below the movie...
What makes your decision to Display Aspect Ratio be so large?

Its a stupid question, your DVDRips are at the same DAR as the original DVD.
THANKS FOR YOUR WORK

Actually, it's not a stupid question: the DAR of "Crazy Heart" DVD is 2.35 (40:17) - and, at any rate, these never exceed 2.40 - see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aspect_ratio_%28image%29. (Please correct me if I'm wrong - and substantiate your claim.)
FXG's DARs are sometimes reasonably bigger, I'm guessing, because watermarks are cropped.
Seems like  good quality. A: 8 V: 8
